arabic: وَالذَّارِيَاتِ ذَرْوًا
english: By the winds that blow and scatter,

arabic: فَالْحَامِلَاتِ وِقْرًا
english: And by the clouds that carry a heavy load (of water),

arabic: فَالْجَارِيَاتِ يُسْرًا
english: And by the vessels that float with elegance,

arabic: فَالْمُقَسِّمَاتِ أَمْرًا
english: And by the angels that distribute work,

arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌ
english: Surely the promise (of the Hereafter) being made to you is absolutely true.

arabic: وَإِنَّ الدِّينَ لَوَاقِعٌ
english: And surely, the reward and the punishment (of actions) are bound to take place.

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءِ ذَاتِ الْحُبُكِ
english: And by the heaven with its galaxies and orbits (of stars and planets),

arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِي قَوْلٍ مُّخْتَلِفٍ
english: Certainly you are (caught) in inconsistent statements.

arabic: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
english: He alone who is turned away (from the knowledge of pre-eternity) turns away (from the Holy Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] and the Qur’an).

arabic: قُتِلَ الْخَرَّاصُونَ
english: Ruined are those who tell lies out of assumption and conjecture,

arabic: الَّذِينَ هُمْ فِي غَمْرَةٍ سَاهُونَ
english: Those who are oblivious (of the Hereafter) due to negligence and ignorance.

arabic: يَسْأَلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ الدِّينِ
english: They ask: ‘When is the Day of Requital?’

arabic: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى النَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
english: (Say:) ‘The Day (when) they will be roasted in the Fire of Hell.’

arabic: ذُوقُوا فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا الَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
english: (It will be said to them:) ‘Relish your punishment. It is this punishment which you seek to hasten.’

arabic: إِنَّ الْمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
english: Surely, the pious will be (rejoicing) in gardens and springs,

arabic: آخِذِينَ مَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
english: Receiving those blessings (in ecstatic delight) which their Lord will be giving them (with munificence and benevolence). Surely, it is they who were people of spiritual excellence (in their life) before this.

arabic: كَانُوا قَلِيلًا مِّنَ اللَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
english: They used to sleep at night only for a short while,

arabic: وَبِالْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
english: And used to (get up and) seek forgiveness in the later part of the night.

arabic: وَفِي أَمْوَالِهِمْ حَقٌّ لِّلسَّائِلِ وَالْمَحْرُومِ
english: And in their wealth was appointed a due share for the beggars and the destitute (i.e., all the needy).

arabic: وَفِي الْأَرْضِ آيَاتٌ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ
english: And there are many signs in the earth for the people with the truth of certitude (i.e., people of perfect certitude),

arabic: وَفِي أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
english: And in your selves (as well). So do you not notice?

arabic: وَفِي السَّمَاءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
english: And (also) there is sustenance for you in the heaven and (all that too) which you are promised.

arabic: فَوَرَبِّ السَّمَاءِ وَالْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُ لَحَقٌّ مِّثْلَ مَا أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
english: So, by the Lord of heavens and the earth, this (promise of Ours) is true just as is your speech. (You firmly believe in what you utter.)

arabic: هَلْ أَتَاكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَاهِيمَ الْمُكْرَمِينَ
english: Has the news of the venerable guests of Ibrahim (Abraham) come to you?

arabic: إِذْ دَخَلُوا عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا سَلَامًا ۖ قَالَ سَلَامٌ قَوْمٌ مُّنكَرُونَ
english: When those (angels) came to him, they wished him peace. Ibrahim (Abraham) also said (in reply): ‘Peace (be upon you)!’ (and thought in his mind that) they were strangers.

arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰ أَهْلِهِ فَجَاءَ بِعِجْلٍ سَمِينٍ
english: Then he went to his home in haste and brought a healthy, roasted calf.

arabic: فَقَرَّبَهُ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
english: Then he presented it to them and said: ‘Will you not eat?’

arabic: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةً ۖ قَالُوا لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَامٍ عَلِيمٍ
english: Then he felt somewhat concerned about them (when they did not eat). They (the angels) said: ‘Do not worry,’ then they gave him the news about a son possessing knowledge and wisdom (Ishaq [Isaac]).

arabic: فَأَقْبَلَتِ امْرَأَتُهُ فِي صَرَّةٍ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌ
english: Then his wife (Sara) came with a voice laden with wonder and frustration, patted her forehead in astonishment and said: ‘(Will) an old and barren woman (give birth to a child)?’

arabic: قَالُوا كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْحَكِيمُ الْعَلِيمُ
english: The (angels) said: ‘It will happen exactly as your Lord has said; surely, He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.’

arabic: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطْبُكُمْ أَيُّهَا الْمُرْسَلُونَ
english: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘O deputed angels, what is your intent (for coming, apart from this good news)?’

arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا أُرْسِلْنَا إِلَىٰ قَوْمٍ مُّجْرِمِينَ
english: They said: ‘We have been sent to the evildoing people (the people of Lut [Lot]),

arabic: لِنُرْسِلَ عَلَيْهِمْ حِجَارَةً مِّن طِينٍ
english: So that we may rain on them THE the stones of baked clay,

arabic: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلْمُسْرِفِينَ
english: (The stones) that have been marked from your Lord for those who transgress.’

arabic: فَأَخْرَجْنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: Then We moved everyone who was of the believers in it out (from the town of the people of Lut [Lot]).

arabic: فَمَا وَجَدْنَا فِيهَا غَيْرَ بَيْتٍ مِّنَ الْمُسْلِمِينَ
english: So We did not find in that town (any house) of the Muslims except one (in which were the Prophet Lut [Lot] and his two daughters).

arabic: وَتَرَكْنَا فِيهَا آيَةً لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ الْعَذَابَ الْأَلِيمَ
english: And We made in that (town) a sign to subsist (as a lesson of warning) for those who fear the grievous torment.

arabic: وَفِي مُوسَىٰ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَاهُ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
english: And (there are signs) in (the incident of) Musa (Moses) as well when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear proof.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكْنِهِ وَقَالَ سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
english: He turned away along with his cabinet members and said: ‘(Here is) a magician or a madman.’

arabic: فَأَخَذْنَاهُ وَجُنُودَهُ فَنَبَذْنَاهُمْ فِي الْيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٌ
english: Then We seized him and his army (with torment), and drowned them (all) in the river. And he was but the perpetrator of condemnable works.

arabic: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ الرِّيحَ الْعَقِيمَ
english: And there is (a sign) in (the destruction of) the people of ‘Ad too when We sent upon them a wind devoid of any good and blessing.

arabic: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيْءٍ أَتَتْ عَلَيْهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتْهُ كَالرَّمِيمِ
english: Whatever it passed over, it did not leave without turning it to dust.

arabic: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ تَمَتَّعُوا حَتَّىٰ حِينٍ
english: And also there is (a sign of warning) in the (destruction of) the people of Thamud when they were told: ‘Take benefit for an appointed term.’

arabic: فَعَتَوْا عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ الصَّاعِقَةُ وَهُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
english: But they disobeyed the command of their Lord. So a horrifying thunder seized them, and they could only stare at it stunned.

arabic: فَمَا اسْتَطَاعُوا مِن قِيَامٍ وَمَا كَانُوا مُنتَصِرِينَ
english: Then they could neither gather strength to stand, nor take revenge (on Us).

arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا قَوْمًا فَاسِقِينَ
english: And (We also destroyed) the people of Nuh (Noah) before this. Surely, they were a people extremely disobedient.

arabic: وَالسَّمَاءَ بَنَيْنَاهَا بِأَيْدٍ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
english: And We built the heavenly universe with great might. And surely, We are expanding (this universe) more and more.

arabic: وَالْأَرْضَ فَرَشْنَاهَا فَنِعْمَ الْمَاهِدُونَ
english: And We alone made (the surface of the) earth a (livable) floor. So how graciously We make up and spread out!

arabic: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيْءٍ خَلَقْنَا زَوْجَيْنِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
english: And of everything We have created two pairs so that you may concentrate and understand.

arabic: فَفِرُّوا إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
english: So run towards Allah. Surely, I am a clear Warner to you from Him.

arabic: وَلَا تَجْعَلُوا مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا آخَرَ ۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنْهُ نَذِيرٌ مُّبِينٌ
english: And do not set up any god apart from Allah. Surely, I am a clear Warner to you from Him.

arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ مَا أَتَى الَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُوا سَاحِرٌ أَوْ مَجْنُونٌ
english: Likewise, no Messenger came to those before them, but they said the same: ‘(This is) a magician or a madman.’

arabic: أَتَوَاصَوْا بِهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
english: Were they transmitting this advice to one another? In truth, they were (all) a disobedient and rebellious people.

arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِمَلُومٍ
english: So turn away your kind and caring looks from them. There is no blame on you (for their disbelief).

arabic: وَذَكِّرْ فَإِنَّ الذِّكْرَىٰ تَنفَعُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
english: And keep giving direction and guidance, for direction and guidance surely benefits the believers.

arabic: وَمَا خَلَقْتُ الْجِنَّ وَالْإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعْبُدُونِ
english: And I created the jinn and human beings solely to adopt My servitude.

arabic: مَا أُرِيدُ مِنْهُم مِّن رِّزْقٍ وَمَا أُرِيدُ أَن يُطْعِمُونِ
english: I do not ask for any sustenance (i.e., earning) from them, nor do I require that they should feed Me.

arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الرَّزَّاقُ ذُو الْقُوَّةِ الْمَتِينُ
english: Truly, Allah alone is the Sustainer of everyone, the Lord of Great Might, the Most Strong. (He does not need anyone’s help and assistance.)

arabic: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ذَنُوبًا مِّثْلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصْحَابِهِمْ فَلَا يَسْتَعْجِلُونِ
english: So there is a fixed share of the torment for these wrongdoers (too) like the share of the torment of their companions (who have passed before). So let them not ask Me to hasten (it).

arabic: فَوَيْلٌ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مِن يَوْمِهِمُ الَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
english: So a terrible destruction awaits the disbelievers on that Day of theirs which they have been promised.
